lead_paragraph: A Florida veterinarian who has conducted a national investigation into breakdowns involving racehorses was named as Kentucky’s first equine medical director. The veterinarian, Dr. Mary Scollay, will help advise on whether — and how — the state should impose steroid tests. The hiring comes at a time when officials have been under fire for not putting in a broad ban on anabolic steroids.
